answer_found_by_llm: Yes, sample1.bin is password protected—as indicated by the “Security: 1” flag—and the password protecting the document is “VelvetSweatshop.”
The document contains hidden sheets. The hidden sheet that starts with “S” is “Sheet2.”
The analysis reveals that sample1.bin does include an obfuscated URL. When deobfuscated, the URL shows that the document attempts to download the next stage from the domain “malicious.com”.
Unable to determine the name of the very hidden sheet in sample2.bin.
No, the macro function used to retrieve system-related information is not specified in sample2.bin.
No network locations linked to payload retrieval were identified.
No filenames within sample2.bin used for saving downloaded payloads were identified.
No processes or executables invoked to execute downloaded or external content were identified.
